tweets.text: A week ago, oil pollution began entering the Peak Forest Canal at Furness Vale. We contacted @CanalRiverTrust EVERY DAY. After 5 days of inaction we went public to get them to take it seriously. We thought they had, but a week later the spill is spreading and worsening. 1/3 https://t.co/tD9bGkkFik
@bobspa2sta @EkudYkcin @EnvAgencyMids Engine actually needs some back pressure to function effectively.

@traveltom84 @CanalRiverTrust @EnvAgency @BBCNews @robertlargan @RuthGeorge6 @HighPeakBC We have to be very careful what we say on social media but we are becoming less confident in some of the things we are being told.
@FoxesAfloat @CanalRiverTrust @EnvAgency @BBCNews @robertlargan @RuthGeorge6 @HighPeakBC Smells like BS to me. This is essential.

@traveltom84 @CanalRiverTrust @EnvAgency @BBCNews @robertlargan @RuthGeorge6 @HighPeakBC We've been told that boaters can't go to their boats because of the restrictions. The marina continue to deny it's coming from there so the @CanalRiverTrust are investigating it. (So we're led to believe)
@PJennings88 can you believe this? https://t.co/FOUOJe4WSm

@FoxesAfloat @CanalRiverTrust @EnvAgency @BBCNews @robertlargan @RuthGeorge6 @HighPeakBC Have you posted this on the Friendly Narrowboat Group on Facebook to see if anyone who owns a boat at the marina may see it and be able to contact the rightfully owner?

@traveltom84 @CanalRiverTrust @EnvAgency @BBCNews @robertlargan @RuthGeorge6 @HighPeakBC The marina have previously stated that none of the boats there are responsible. However, the @CanalRiverTrust have told me one of their boats is under investigation as the pollution starts from that area (Confirmed by other dog walkers etc).

@FoxesAfloat @CanalRiverTrust @EnvAgency @BBCNews @robertlargan @RuthGeorge6 @HighPeakBC Yes it's awful,but if a boater was causing that they would be in uproar and giving out fines and penalties like cleaning bills!
@FoxesAfloat @CanalRiverTrust @EnvAgency @BBCNews @robertlargan @RuthGeorge6 @HighPeakBC Surely the staff at the marina have an obligation to help resolve the situation?

@CanalRiverTrust @EnvAgency @BBCNews @robertlargan @RuthGeorge6 @HighPeakBC Monitor the situation? It's been a week. Yes, the polluter is the one at blame here but you are responsible for stopping the spread of this pollution and you've had a week to do something. Visiting and monitoring isn't stopping the pollution from spreading or from removing it.
@loosecollie that's ridiculous! do the rivers nees dredged by any chance??

@FoxesAfloat @EnvAgency @BBCNews @robertlargan @RuthGeorge6 @HighPeakBC @FoxesAfloat We are continuing to monitor the situation at this site. Our team have visited throughout the week and are continuing to do so.

@GoldenHare3 @CanalRiverTrust @EnvAgency @BBCNews @robertlargan @RuthGeorge6 @HighPeakBC We've been told that boaters can't visit their boats at the marina where it's suspected the pollution is coming from which I would imagine makes it difficult to investigate. However, the @CanalRiverTrust staff could be doing a lot more to stop the pollution from spreading üëçüèª
